label: Policy LCD_36204
description: Policy rules for LCD_36204

label: diagnosis_chronic_intractab...
description: Condition for which Spinal Cord Stimulators (SCS) may be covered

label: diagnosis_reflex_sympatheti...
description: Consideration for patients with reflex sympathetic dystrophy in SCS trial: may show lower levels of improvement and takes longer periods for improvement

label: diagnosis_code_icd10 IN Z45.42
description: Field: diagnosis_code_icd10

label: scs_therapy_pain_type_neuro...
description: Indicates if SCS therapy is best suited for neuropathic pain

label: prior_conservative_therapy_...
description: SCS therapy should be considered a late option after more conservative attempts (medications, physical therapy, psychological therapy, or other modalities) have been tried

label: patient_multidisciplinary_s...
description: Patients must undergo careful screening, evaluation and diagnosis by a multidisciplinary team prior to SCS implantation

label: patient_psychological_evalu...
description: Psychological evaluation is a required component of patient screening prior to SCS implantation

label: patient_physical_evaluation...
description: Physical evaluation is a required component of patient screening prior to SCS implantation

label: patient_active_substance_ab...
description: Exclusion criteria: patient must not have active substance abuse issues

label: scs_trial_prerequisite_for_...
description: Performance and documentation of an effective SCS trial is a prerequisite for permanent nerve stimulation

label: scs_replacement_no_trial_ne...
description: Circumstances where a new SCS trial is not needed for stimulator replacement (battery change, malfunction, or end of stimulator life)

label: patient_education_disclosur...
description: Patient must undergo proper education, discussion, and disclosure, including an extensive discussion of the risks and benefits of SCS therapy

label: scs_trial_setting_preferred...
description: Preferred setting for temporary neurostimulator placement (ASC or outpatient hospital setting)

label: scs_trial_setting_office_cr...
description: Conditions required for a temporary neurostimulator trial to be performed in an office setting (sterility, equipment, professional training, and support personnel)

label: scs_permanent_implant_setti...
description: Required setting for permanent neurostimulator placement (ASC or hospital)

label: scs_trial_positive_response...
description: Only patients who experience a positive response to an SCS trial should proceed to permanent implantation

label: scs_trial_success_pain_redu...
description: Threshold for a successful SCS trial: at least 50% reduction of target pain

label: scs_trial_success_functiona...
description: Threshold for a successful SCS trial: show some element of functional improvement

label: scs_trials_max_count_per_re...
description: Maximum number of SCS trials allowed per anatomic spinal region per patient per lifetime

label: scs_trials_max_count_except...
description: Criteria allowing exceptions to the maximum number of SCS trials (technical limitations for initial trials or use of different modalities of stimulation, including new technology)

label: scs_repeat_trial_allowed_cr...
description: Criteria under which a repeat SCS trial is appropriate after an initial failure (extenuating circumstances)

label: physician_scs_trial_office_...
description: Required physician qualifications for performing SCS trials in an office setting: like privileges at a local hospital or ASC, OR subspecialty boarded in Pain Medicine by the American Board of Anesthesiology

label: physician_trial_to_implant_...
description: Physician trial to permanent implant ratio threshold (less than 50%) triggering post-payment review

label: scs_leads_max_count <= 2
description: Maximum number of SCS leads reimbursed by Noridian

label: scs_contacts_max_count <= 16
description: Maximum number of SCS contacts reimbursed by Noridian
